page_analysis.text_content:
Lot
coverage
&
floor area

These terms are used to
describe the amount of
development on a lot.

Lot coverage describes
how much of the lot is
covered by structures
but doesn't evaluate the
mass of those structures.

Gross floor area
describes the mass
of the structures by
reflecting the cumulative
square footage of all
visible levels.

Code sections
Page 4–5
18.12.040 (a) Table 2
18.12.040 (b) Table 3
18.04.030 (a) (86)

4

Lot coverage
Maximum allowable
Allowable lot coverage is expressed by a ratio—35% of
the lot size.

Example calculation:

For a 7,000 sf lot, the allowable
lot coverage would be:

0.35 x 7,000 sf = 2,450 sf

Lot coverage includes:
• footprints of all structures including main resi-
dence, covered parking, tool sheds, covered pool
equipment units, etc.
• projecting elements such as balconies, stairways,
porches, patio covers, etc.
• decking that exceeds 30" above grade.
• for roof overhangs or eaves that exceed 4', the por-
tion that is beyond 4'.
• swimming pools and spas that exceed 30"
above grade.
Lot coverage excludes:
• roof overhangs up to 4'.
• uncovered structures less than 30" above grade.

An additional 5% coverage is permitted for covered
patios, canopies and roof overhangs beyond 4 feet.

Note: To qualify as a structure that is less than 30
inches above grade, a porch or deck may only have
open railings above 30 inches—no solid half walls.

Gross Floor area
Maximum allowable
Allowable gross floor area is expressed by a ratio—the
sum of 45% of the first 5,000 sf of lot area plus 30% of
any portion of lot area in excess of 5,000 sf.

Example calculation:

For a 7,000 sf lot, the allowable
gross floor area would be:

0.45 x 5,000 sf = 2,250 sf
0.30 x 2,000 sf = 600 sf

Total = 2,850 sf

Gross floor area includes:
• the sum of all the floors in a main structure mea-
sured to the outside of the exterior stud walls.
• stairwells at all floors and all areas that are greater
than 50% enclosed and covered.
• covered parking and all accessory buildings which
are greater than 120 square feet.
• spaces that meet the criteria for second and third
floor equivalents.

Note: The main house may not
exceed 6,000 sf, regardless of
the size of the lot.

qualifiers.text: To qualify as a structure that is less than 30 inches above grade

conditions.text: Allowable lot coverage is expressed by a ratio—35% of the lot size.
for roof overhangs or eaves that exceed 4', the portion that is beyond 4'.
swimming pools and spas that exceed 30" above grade.
uncovered structures less than 30" above grade.
An additional 5% coverage is permitted for covered patios, canopies and roof overhangs beyond 4 feet.
Allowable gross floor area is expressed by a ratio—the sum of 45% of the first 5,000 sf of lot area plus 30% of any portion of lot area in excess of 5,000 sf.
stairwells at all floors and all areas that are greater than 50% enclosed and covered.
covered parking and all accessory buildings which are greater than 120 square feet.
The main house may not exceed 6,000 sf, regardless of the size of the lot.
a porch or deck may only have open railings above 30 inches—no solid half walls.

logical_relationships.expression: IF decking exceeds 30" above grade THEN it is included in Lot coverage.
IF roof overhangs or eaves exceed 4' THEN the portion beyond 4' is included in Lot coverage.
IF swimming pools and spas exceed 30" above grade THEN they are included in Lot coverage.
IF roof overhangs are up to 4' THEN they are excluded from Lot coverage.
IF uncovered structures are less than 30" above grade THEN they are excluded from Lot coverage.
IF covered patios, canopies and roof overhangs are beyond 4 feet THEN an additional 5% coverage is permitted.
IF stairwells and areas are greater than 50% enclosed and covered THEN they are included in Gross floor area.
IF covered parking and accessory buildings are greater than 120 square feet THEN they are included in Gross floor area.
The main house GFA must not exceed 6,000 sf, regardless of lot size.
IF a structure is less than 30 inches above grade (q1) THEN a porch or deck may only have open railings above 30 inches and no solid half walls.

execution_sequence.action: Calculate allowable lot coverage based on lot size and condition c1.
Identify elements to include in lot coverage based on conditions c2, c3, c4 and other listed items.
Identify elements to exclude from lot coverage based on conditions c5, c6.
Apply additional 5% coverage for specific elements based on condition c7.
Calculate allowable gross floor area based on lot size and condition c8.
Identify elements to include in gross floor area based on conditions c9, c10 and other listed items.
Ensure main house GFA does not exceed 6,000 sf as per condition c11.
Evaluate specific requirements for porches/decks on structures less than 30 inches above grade, based on qualifier q1 and condition c12.
